item.title: Acquisition vs. Rapid Reacquisition of Conditioned Freezing
item.description: ## here() starts at /Users/amywilliams/Desktop/datavis/amy_williams_blogdown ## ── Attaching packages ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.2.1 ── ## ✔ ggplot2 2.2.1 ✔ purrr 0.2.5 ## ✔ tibble 1.4.2 ✔ dplyr 0.7.5 ## ✔ tidyr 0.8.1 ✔ stringr 1.3.1 ## ✔ ggplot2 2.2.1 ✔ forcats 0.3.0 ## ── Conflicts ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() 1) The code: data <- read_csv(here("static/data","test1_avg_hits_bi.csv")) ## Warning: Missing column names filled in: 'X1' [1] ## Parsed with column specification: ## cols( ## X1 = col_double(), ## cohort = col_character(), ## hitL = col_character(), ## hitR = col_character(), ## group = col_character(), ## treatment = col_character(), ## pf = col_double() ## ) ggplot(data, aes(x= group, y=pf, color = treatment)) + geom_boxplot(outlier.

item.title: CS 631 Data Viz Final Slide Deck
item.description: For my CS 631 Data Visualization final brief that I presented in class, I explored using boxplot + facet wrapping to compare the increase in cFos activity following different behavioral measures faceted by different brain regions. Here are some my slides made with Xaringan. Enjoy!

item.title: Gun Sales in the Top Selling States

item.title: How Modern is the MoMA? Purchases of Paintings by MoMA Over the Years
item.description: This post contains my visualization of the MoMA’s Purchasing Patterns by Year of Creation of the Painting. I was trying to determine what era of art the MoMa purchases from and if the year of creation followed the year of purchasing. Package Install ## here() starts at /Users/amywilliams/Desktop/datavis/amy_williams_blogdown ## ── Attaching packages ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.2.1 ── ## ✔ ggplot2 2.2.1 ✔ purrr 0.2.5 ## ✔ tibble 1.4.2 ✔ dplyr 0.7.5 ## ✔ tidyr 0.

item.title: Plotly Html Widget: Multiple Regression
item.description: This work is VERY closely adaped from Modern Dive, an online R stats book. 1) The code: Packages library(readr) library(here) ## here() starts at /Users/amywilliams/Desktop/datavis/amy_williams_blogdown library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.2.1 ── ## ✔ ggplot2 2.2.1 ✔ purrr 0.2.5 ## ✔ tibble 1.4.2 ✔ dplyr 0.7.5 ## ✔ tidyr 0.8.1 ✔ stringr 1.3.1 ## ✔ ggplot2 2.2.1 ✔ forcats 0.3.0 ## ── Conflicts ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() library(plotly) ## ## Attaching package: 'plotly' ## The following object is masked from 'package:ggplot2': ## ## last_plot ## The following object is masked from 'package:stats': ## ## filter ## The following object is masked from 'package:graphics': ## ## layout Graph:
